text: anyone have recommendations for mid level Android books? i was in barnes & noble yesterday and saw a few that had some topics that would be new and fun for me

attachments.text: Android Recipes: A Problem-Solution Approach [Dave Smith, Jeff Friesen] on <http://Amazon.com|Amazon.com>. *FREE* shipping on qualifying offers. Android continues to be one of the leading mobile OS and development platforms driving today's mobile innovations and the apps ecosystem. Android appears complex

text: I think I have that one. It’s good for reference on interesting tasks. Just depends on if they have updated it in a little while

If my server doesn’t use a cache header, then using a cache for volley just takes up memory for no reason, right?

Also, why would we ever want to cache at the http layer? Just if we’re too lazy to make our own caching of the deserialized response?

has somebody used the new feature of the gradle plugin 1.4.0-beta1 to autogenerate svg to pngs. if so what were the steps you did to get it working? where to save the svg, specify generateDenisities, and so on?
It doesn't do it from SVG afaik. I just placed vector drawables in the drawable folder and that's it. Make sure your minSdk is < 21
ah ok. but if i define a vector drawable in the drawable folder and build with gradle i get the following error: could not find class: apple.awt.CGraphicsEnvironment
Hm I saw this on the issue tracker before I think
